document_title: Cystitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Add plenty of water, especially for patients undergoing chemotherapy or radiation therapy. You should drink about 2 - 2.5 liters of water/day; Limit drinking coffee, tea, alcohol, orange juice, lemon juice and avoid spicy foods. Because these foods have the ability to irritate the bladder, creating more discomfort; Urinate as soon as you feel the urge to urinate, don't hold it in for too long.; Proper hygiene: after defecation, you need to wash and wipe from front to back to prevent bacteria from spreading from the anus, vagina to the urethra.; If you have a urinary tract infection, you should take a shower instead of a bath.; It is necessary to gently wash the skin around the vagina and anus every day. Note that you should not use cleaning solutions that contain too strong detergents because the skin in this area is very sensitive and easily irritated.; Go to the bathroom as soon as possible after having sex. You should drink another full glass of water to help remove bacteria from your body.; After identifying signs of cystitis in women, you should maintain hygiene during menstruation, regularly change sanitary napkins (about every 3-4 hours).; Using a towel or hot pack on the abdomen will help reduce the feeling of tightness and bladder pain.; Wearing clothes that are too tight is also a cause of cystitis. Clothes that are too tight will cause body temperature to rise, thereby causing moisture in the private area. This is a favorable opportunity for bacteria to multiply and develop.
